episode.content: In the midst of a global pandemic, the world is reexamining social mechanisms and values. Meanwhile, creators are looking to ancient civilizations and lifestyles to see what we can learn, and their designs have won acclaim. Architect Tsuyoshi Tane explores designs for the future that were inspired by ancient history.
episode.description: Today's theme: Ancient Design. At a time when we're reexamining our values some creators are inspired by ancient life and civilizations. Architect Tsuyoshi Tane explores the future through our past.
episode.subtitle: Ancient Design
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: On Design Hunts Andy and Shaula search for designs rooted in regional history and climates. This time they visit Gunma Prefecture, which has been making silk for 1,300 years. It's home to countless historic buildings connected to a culture of silk, including the Tomioka Silk Mill, a World Heritage Site. Gunma still has Japan's highest number of silkworm farms, and is its biggest producer of cocoons and raw silk. Today cutting-edge technology and traditional techniques have merged to create new textiles of extraordinary beauty. Discover how meticulous handiwork and artistic sensibilities have influenced the prefecture's designs. Join us on a design hunt in Gunma!
episode.description: Today's theme: Design Hunting in Gunma. The local silk industry has a 1,300-year history, creating a rich culture of textiles alongside meticulous and artistic work. Join us on a design hunt in Gunma.
episode.subtitle: Design Hunting in Gunma
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: A special two-part series of discussions between leading Japanese product designer Naoto Fukasawa and top interface designer Yugo Nakamura. In part 1, Nakamura dives into the extraordinary forms and simple beauty of Fukasawa's designs. 2 cutting-edge designers outline their thoughts on the future of creativity.
episode.description: Top Japanese product designer Naoto Fukasawa and global interface designer Yugo Nakamura discuss their experiences and philosophies in a two-part special! In part one we explore Fukasawa's designs.
episode.subtitle: Designing Emergence: Part 1
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: A special two-part series of discussions between leading Japanese product designer Naoto Fukasawa and top interface designer Yugo Nakamura. In part 2, Fukasawa explores Nakamura's intriguing interfaces which connect the virtual and physical worlds. 2 cutting-edge designers outline their thoughts on the future of creativity.
episode.description: Top Japanese product designer Naoto Fukasawa and global interface designer Yugo Nakamura discuss their experiences and philosophies in a two-part special! In part two dive into Nakamura's designs.
episode.subtitle: Designing Emergence: Part 2
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: On Design Hunts Andy and Shaula search for designs rooted in regional history and climates. This time they visit Ishikawa Prefecture. In the first episode, they explore the historic city of Kanazawa and its many traditions. A castle town and stronghold of the Kaga domain, it flourished under the Maeda family as the home of traditional arts, crafts and foods. Today structures such as the glass dome and Noh drum gate of Kanazawa station, and the 21st Century Museum of Contemporary Art have also put it on the map for cutting-edge design. Discover how the city is still creating arts and crafts while shaping a future for regional culture. Join us on a design hunt in Kanazawa!
episode.description: Today's theme: Design Hunting in Kanazawa, Ishikawa prefecture. This historic castle town is home to a variety of traditional arts, crafts, and food as well as dazzling modern architecture and design.
episode.subtitle: Design Hunting in Kanazawa, Ishikawa Prefecture
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: On Design Hunts Andy and Shaula search for designs rooted in regional history and climates. This time they visit Ishikawa Prefecture. In the second episode, they explore the Noto peninsula and its stunning vistas of land and sea. Its isolated location led to unbroken traditions such as Wajima-nuri and other handicrafts and natural materials. New designs showcase the beauty of Noto, its unique time scale, and the sustainable creativity that comes from living alongside nature. Join us on a design hunt in Noto!
episode.description: Today's theme: Design Hunting in Noto, Ishikawa prefecture. This peninsula offers stunning vistas of land and sea as well as sustainable handicrafts and materials rooted in its unique geography.
episode.subtitle: Design Hunting in Noto, Ishikawa Prefecture
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: Humanity has always dreamed of the future and the many forms it might take. Designers and artists have been inspired by its possibilities and used their imaginations to create artworks and products. What kind of future can we create during the coronavirus pandemic? Architect Toyoda Keisuke explores a world of new designs.
episode.description: Today's theme: The Future II. The future has always inspired designers and artists. What kind of future can we build during a pandemic? Architect Toyoda Keisuke explores a world of new designs.
episode.subtitle: The Future II
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: On Design Hunts Andy and Shaula search for designs rooted in regional history and climates. This time they visit Chiba Prefecture. Surrounded by the sea on 3 sides, warm currents keep the local climate mild enough for spring flowers to bloom in December, drawing visitors from all over Japan. As Tokyo's neighbor Chiba is also popular among people looking for a new home, and those establishing a second base. Chiba is also a hub for new design projects. Join us on a design hunt for creative and imaginative designs shaped by this region's welcoming and laidback atmosphere!
episode.description: Today's theme: Design Hunting in Chiba. Local currents keep Chiba warm, with flowers blooming in December. Tokyo's neighbor also attracts a creative crowd. Join us on a hunt for imaginative designs.
episode.subtitle: Design Hunting in Chiba
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: Translation: the act of communicating words of one language to those who do not know it. On this episode, Dominique Chen guides Andy and Shaula through an exhibition exploring this very theme through a variety of designs that offer new perspectives on the world from different linguistic and non-linguistic layers. Explore new avenues of communication in an increasingly fragmented world through "Translations."
episode.description: Today's theme: Translations. The act of communicating words in one language to those who don't know it. An exhibition directed by Dominique Chen explores many links between translation and design.
episode.subtitle: Translations
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: As the world grapples with a global pandemic and environmental crises, many are reexamining their relationships with the objects around them. Guest Nagaoka Kenmei's belief in long-life design offers a way forward. He reevaluates the items that have been made for decades, and become an inextricable part of our everyday lives. Explore the beloved designs which have transcended generations.
episode.description: Today's theme: Long Life Design. The pandemic and environmental concerns mean that we're all reassessing our relationship with objects. Guest Nagaoka Kenmei explores how long-life design can help.
episode.subtitle: Long Life Design
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: The d47 MUSEUM in Shibuya, Tokyo showcases Japan's 47 prefectures, exploring their unique beauty and culture through regional designs. Guest Nagaoka Kenmei curated its Reverent Design exhibition. Today, he shows us around, explaining how the concept could shape our lives and craftsmanship going forward.
episode.description: Today's theme is Inori: Reverent Design. Tokyo's d47 MUSEUM showcases the best of Japan's 47 prefectures. Nagaoka Kenmei's Reverent Design exhibition explores reverence in our lives and craftsmanship.
episode.subtitle: Inori: Reverent Design
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: The rise in remote work and workations have led to massive changes in the relationship between our jobs and lives at home. Some have been inspired to reexamine their lifestyles and move from the city to the countryside. Designer Kobayashi Shinya connects craftsmanship and everyday life by reinvigorating local industry. Art director Hirose Kiyoharu works on social design projects that conserve local natural environments. They explore future possibilities for connecting work and home life.
episode.description: Today's theme: Work Life. Remote work, workations, and an exodus of workers from metropolitan to rural areas: Explore how we are rethinking the relationship between our private and professional lives.
episode.subtitle: Work Life
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: Exhaustion and stress are taking their toll as the coronavirus pandemic continues. Supportive, relaxing designs are beginning to attract notice. Meet a pet-style robot designed to have no practical purpose, discover humorous gifts, and charming signs. Product designer Nezu Kota explores the world of compassionate design.
episode.description: Today's theme: Compassionate design. Pandemic exhaustion and stress have led to a rise in relaxing designs. From pet robots to comical signs product designer Nezu Kota explores communication design.
episode.subtitle: Compassionate Design
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: The Mingei movement began in 1926 but still has an enormous impact on Japanese product design today. As we all re-evaluate our lifestyles in the midst of a pandemic, explore how Mingei helped shape the design of ordinary items around Japan. Guest Takaki Takao runs a craftwork shop in Fukuoka and explores what lies ahead for our everyday lives.
episode.description: Today's theme: Mingei, or Japanese Folk Crafts. These traditional crafts influence Japanese product design. The pandemic has brought them renewed attention. Explore their past, present, and future!
episode.subtitle: Mingei: Japanese Folk Craft
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus

episode.content: Our topic this time is Part of the Whole. Our guests are up-and-coming architectural duo Masuda Shingo and Otsubo Katsuhisa. By focusing on which elements really need to change, they examine windows, walls and foundations. Their work creates new relationships between architecture and the surrounding environment. As we stand at a turning point for new lifestyles, explore potential futures.
episode.description: Today's theme: Part of the Whole. Architects Masuda Shingo and Otsubo Katsuhisa focus on windows, walls, and other structural parts to change the whole. Explore how their ideas might shape our future.
episode.subtitle: Part of the Whole
episode.title: DESIGN TALKS plus
